meanings.definition: In a shy or embarrassed manner
meanings.sent1: He looked sheepishly at the ground after dropping his ice cream cone.
meanings.sent2: Sheepishly, she admitted to forgetting her friend's birthday.
meanings.sent3: Feeling sheepishly awkward, he tried to hide behind a potted plant.
meanings.sent4: Sheepishly, the young boy returned the toy he had taken without permission.
meanings.sent5: The student sheepishly raised his hand to ask a question in class.

meanings.definition: Showing embarrassment or lack of confidence
meanings.sent1: The sheepishly smiling girl blushed when complimented on her artwork.
meanings.sent2: He gave a sheepishly apologetic smile after spilling his drink.
meanings.sent3: The sheepishly hesitant puppy slowly approached the unfamiliar object.
meanings.sent4: Sheepishly avoiding eye contact, he shuffled his feet nervously.
meanings.sent5: The sheepishly awkward teenager fidgeted with his sleeves during the presentation.
